means: direct read after write 写入后直接读出，写后可读

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词都有"拖，拉"之意。
sameAnalysis.word_list: drag, draw, pull, haul, tug, tow, jerk
means: drag ： 指沿斜坡而上或水平方向缓慢地拖或拉十分沉重的人或物。作借喻时可指把人硬拉扯过来。
draw ： 指将人或物朝出力者的方向拖，不涉及力的大小，含平稳意味，常作借喻用。
pull ： 最普通用词，包含本组其它各词的一些意思，可指朝各个方向拉，侧重一时或突然拉动的动作。
haul ： 指用力拖或拉，不涉及方向，多作航海用词。
tug ： 多指一阵阵地用力拖或拉，但不一定使被拉的人或物移动。
tow ： 特指用绳子或链条等拖或拉本身无动力或无法使用自身动力的东西。

sentence.Network_en: Entry to this prize draw is limited to UK residents.
sentence.Network_cn: 这次抽奖只限英国公民参加。

jx.jx_en_mean: cause someone to bleed, especially in the course of a fight

lj.lj_ly: the blow drew blood from the corner of his mouth.
lj.lj_ls: 这一拳打得他嘴角出血。

lj.lj_ly: she knew she'd drawn blood when the smile faded from his face.
lj.lj_ls: 看到他脸上的笑容褪去，她知道自己已经让他感到了痛苦。

jx.jx_en_mean: attract hostile criticism away from a more important target
jx.jx_cn_mean: 吸引火力，代做靶子，招致批评（以转移批评方的注意力）

lj.lj_ly: the concession will go some way to draw the fire of the government's critics.
lj.lj_ls: 所作让步将在一定程度上使政府的批评者转移火力。

jx.jx_en_mean: set a limit of what one is willing to do or accept, beyond which one will not go
jx.jx_cn_mean: 以…为最后界线，限制，拒绝

lj.lj_ly: she drew the line at prostitution.
she drew the line at prostitution.
she drew the line at prostitution.

jx.jx_en_mean: (Cricket)take the stumps out of the ground at close of play

jx.jx_en_mean: very fast in taking one's gun from its holster

lj.lj_ly: the nights were drawing in fast.

jx.jx_en_mean: put an item of clothing on

jx.jx_en_mean: gently or subtly persuade someone to talk or become more expansive

lj.lj_ly: she drew me out and flattered me.
the transition was long and drawn out.

jx.jx_en_mean: prepare a plan, proposal, agreement, or other document in detail

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English dragan, of Germanic origin; related to Dutch dragen and German tragen, also to draught

entry.def: When you draw, or when you draw something, you use a pencil or pen to produce a picture, pattern, or diagram.

example.ex: She would sit there drawing with the pencil stub...
example.tran: 她会坐在那儿用铅笔头画画。

example.ex: Draw a rough design for a logo...
example.tran: 画一个公司标志的草图。

entry.def: When a vehicle draws somewhere, it moves there smoothly and steadily.

example.ex: Claire had seen the taxi drawing away...
example.tran: 克莱尔看到出租车缓缓开走了。

example.ex: A carriage door struck him as a train drew into Basildon station.
example.tran: 当火车驶进巴斯尔登站时，一节车厢的门撞到他了。

entry.def: If you draw somewhere, you move there slowly.

example.ex: She drew away and did not smile...
example.tran: 她慢慢走开了，脸上没有笑容。

example.ex: When we drew level, he neither slowed down nor accelerated.
example.tran: 当我们齐头并进时，他既没有慢下来也没有加速。

entry.def: If you draw something or someone in a particular direction, you move them in that direction, usually by pulling them gently.

example.ex: He drew his chair nearer the fire...
example.tran: 他把椅子拉到离炉火更近的位置。

example.ex: He put his arm around Caroline's shoulders and drew her close to him...
example.tran: 他一只手臂搂住卡罗琳的肩膀，将她拉近自己。

entry.def: When you draw a curtain or blind, you pull it across a window, either to cover or to uncover it.

example.ex: After drawing the curtains, she lit a candle...
example.tran: 拉上窗帘后，她点燃了蜡烛。

example.ex: Mother was lying on her bed, with the blinds drawn.
example.tran: 母亲正躺在床上，百叶窗已经拉了下来。

entry.tran: 拔出，抽出，掏出(枪、刀等武器)
entry.def: If someone draws a gun, knife, or other weapon, they pull it out of its container and threaten you with it.

example.ex: He drew his dagger and turned to face his pursuers.
example.tran: 他拔出匕首转身面向追他的人。

entry.def: If an animal or vehicle draws something such as a cart, carriage, or another vehicle, it pulls it along.

example.ex: ...a slow-moving tractor, drawing a trailer.
example.tran: 拖着一辆挂车的移动缓慢的拖拉机

example.ex: ...a chariot drawn by six black mules.
example.tran: 6 匹黑色骡子拉着的一辆双轮敞篷马车

entry.def: If you draw a deep breath, you breathe in deeply once.

example.ex: He paused, drawing a deep breath.
example.tran: 他停了下来，深深地吸了口气。

entry.def: If you draw on a cigarette, you breathe the smoke from it into your mouth or lungs.

example.ex: He drew on an American cigarette...
example.tran: 他抽着一根美国产的香烟。

example.ex: Her cheeks hollowed as she drew smoke into her lungs.
example.tran: 当她把烟吸进肺里时，她的双颊瘪了下去。

entry.def: To draw something such as water or energy from a particular source means to take it from that source.

example.ex: Villagers still have to draw their water from wells.
example.tran: 村民们仍然要从井里打水。

entry.def: If something that hits you or presses part of your body draws blood, it cuts your skin so that it bleeds.

example.ex: Any practice that draws blood could increase the risk of getting the virus.
example.tran: 任何引起出血的做法都可能会增加感染病毒的危险。

entry.def: If you draw money out of a bank, building society, or savings account, you get it from the account so that you can use it.

example.ex: She was drawing out cash from a cash machine...
example.tran: 她正从自动提款机中取钱。

example.ex: Companies could not draw money from bank accounts as cash.
example.tran: 公司不能从银行账户中提取现金。

entry.def: If you draw a salary or a sum of money, you receive a sum of money regularly.

example.ex: For the first few years I didn't draw any salary at all...
example.tran: 在开始的几年里我分文未取。

example.ex: He is moving ever closer to drawing his pension.
example.tran: 他就要领取养老金了。

entry.tran: (在比赛等中)抽(签);(在摸彩中)抽(奖)
entry.def: To draw something means to choose it or to be given it, as part of a competition, game, or lottery.

example.ex: We delved through a sackful of letters to draw the winning name...
example.tran: 我们把手探进一袋信件中抽取获奖者。

example.ex: Aston Villa have drawn a Czech team in the first round of the UEFA Cup.
example.tran: 欧洲联盟杯首轮阿斯顿维拉队抽到了一支捷克球队。

entry.def: A draw is a competition where people pay money for numbered or named tickets, then some of those tickets are chosen, and the owners are given prizes.
To draw something from a particular thing or place means to take or get it from that thing or place.

example.ex: I draw strength from the millions of women who have faced this challenge successfully...
example.tran: 我从数百万成功面对这种挑战的女性身上汲取力量。

example.ex: The students are drawn from a cross-section of backgrounds.
example.tran: 这些学生是从成长背景具代表性的候选群体中选取出来的。

entry.def: If you draw a particular conclusion, you decide that that conclusion is true.

example.ex: He draws two conclusions from this...
example.tran: 他从这件事中得出两个结论。

example.ex: He says he cannot yet draw any conclusions about the murders.
example.tran: 他说他还不能对几起谋杀下结论。

entry.tran: 作(比较或对比)；加以(区别)
entry.def: If you draw a comparison, parallel, or distinction, you compare or contrast two different ideas, systems, or other things.

example.ex: ...literary critics drawing comparisons between George Sand and George Eliot...
example.tran: 将乔治·桑德和乔治·艾略特进行比较的文学评论家

example.ex: Interesting distinctions can be drawn between the two populations.
example.tran: 比较两类人可以发现有趣的差异。

entry.def: If you draw someone's attention to something, you make them aware of it or make them think about it.

example.ex: He was waving his arms to draw their attention...
example.tran: 他正挥手以引起他们的注意。

example.ex: He just wants to draw attention to the plight of the unemployed.
example.tran: 他仅仅是想引起人们对失业者困境的关注。

entry.def: If someone or something draws a particular reaction, people react to it in that way.

example.ex: Such a policy would inevitably draw fierce resistance from farmers.
example.tran: 这种政策必然会招致农场主的强烈抵制。

example.ex: ...an official tour to South Africa which drew angry political reactions.
example.tran: 引起政治上的愤怒反应的一次官方的南非之行

entry.def: If something such as a film or an event draws a lot of people, it is so interesting or entertaining that a lot of people go to it.

example.ex: The game is currently drawing huge crowds.
example.tran: 这个游戏现在吸引了很多人。

entry.tran: 使倾心;使动心;强烈吸引
entry.def: If someone or something draws you, it attracts you very strongly.

example.ex: He drew and enthralled her...
example.tran: 他令她动心，让她着迷。

example.ex: What drew him to the area was its proximity to central London.
example.tran: 吸引他到该地区的原因是那里靠近伦敦市中心。

entry.tran: 使回答;使透露消息;使说出意见
entry.def: If someone will not be drawn or refuses to be drawn, they will not reply to questions in the way that you want them to, or will not reveal information or their opinion.

example.ex: The ambassador would not be drawn on questions of a political nature...
example.tran: 大使不会对政治问题发表意见。

example.ex: 'Did he say why?' — 'No, he refuses to be drawn.'
example.tran: “他说为什么了吗？”——“没有,他拒绝透露任何消息。”

entry.def: In a game or competition, if one person or team draws with another one, or if two people or teams draw, they have the same number of points or goals at the end of the game.

example.ex: Holland and the Republic of Ireland drew one-one...
example.tran: 荷兰队和爱尔兰队打成了一比一平。

example.ex: We drew with Ireland in the first game...
example.tran: 在第一场比赛中我们和爱尔兰队打平了。

entry.def: When an event or period of time draws to a close or draws to an end, it finishes.

example.ex: Another celebration had drawn to its close.
example.tran: 又一场庆典结束了。

entry.def: If an event or period of time is drawing closer or is drawing nearer, it is approaching.

example.ex: And all the time next spring's elections are drawing closer...
example.tran: 明年春天的选举即将来临。

example.ex: As the day set for departure drew near, I told my wife that I could not accompany them.
example.tran: 起程的日子就要到了,我告诉妻子我不能陪他们了。

sentences.sentence: "he was the biggest drawing card they had"

8. give a description of;

sentences.sentence: "He drew an elaborate plan of attack"

sentences.sentence: "The President's comments drew sharp criticism from the Republicans"
"The comedian drew a lot of laughter"

means.word_mean: 11. suck in or take (air);

sentences.sentence: "The doctors drew medical supplies from the hospital's emergency bank"

means.word_mean: 14. choose at random;

16. bring or lead someone to a certain action or condition;

sentences.sentence: "The President refused to be drawn into delivering an ultimatum"
"The session was drawn to a close"

means.word_mean: 17. cause to flow;
18. write a legal document or paper;

sentences.sentence: "The deed was drawn in the lawyer's office"

means.word_mean: 19. engage in drawing;

sentences.sentence: "He spent the day drawing in the garden"

means.word_mean: 20. move or pull so as to cover or uncover something;
21. allow a draft;
22. require a specified depth for floating;
23. pull (a person) apart with four horses tied to his extremities, so as to execute him;

sentences.sentence: "in the old days, people were drawn and quartered for certain crimes"

means.word_mean: 24. take in, also metaphorically;

sentences.sentence: "She drew strength from the minister's words"

means.word_mean: 25. direct toward itself or oneself by means of some psychological power or physical attributes;

sentences.sentence: "Her good looks attract the stares of many men"
"The ad pulled in many potential customers"
"The store owner was happy that the ad drew in many new customers"

means.word_mean: 26. thread on or as if on a string;

sentences.sentence: "the child drew glass beads on a string"

means.word_mean: 27. pull back the sling of (a bow);
28. guide or pass over something;

sentences.sentence: "He ran his eyes over her body"
"She ran her fingers along the carved figurine"
"He drew her hair through his fingers"

means.word_mean: 29. finish a game with an equal number of points, goals, etc.;
30. contract;

sentences.sentence: "The material drew after it was washed in hot water"

32. steep; pass through a strainer;
33. remove the entrails of;
34. flatten, stretch, or mold metal or glass, by rolling or by pulling it through a die or by stretching;
35. cause to localize at one point;
